title:
Citizen ASAS-SN Data Release II: Variable Star Classification Using
  Citizen Science
authors:
O. Kotrach, C. S. Kochanek, C. T. Christy, T. Jayasinghe, K. Z.
  Stanek, D. M. Rowan, J. L. Prieto, B. J. Shappee
abstract:
We present the second results from Citizen ASAS-SN, a citizen science project
for the All-Sky Automated Survey for Supernovae (ASAS-SN) hosted on the
Zooniverse platform. Citizen ASAS-SN tasks users with classifying variable
stars based on their light curves. We started with 94975 new variable
candidates and identified 4432 new variable stars. The users classified the new
variables as 841 pulsating variables, 2995 rotational variables, 350 eclipsing
binaries, and 246 unknown variables. We found 68% user agreement for
user-classified pulsating variables, 51% for rotational variables, and 77% for
eclipsing binaries. We investigate user statistics and compare new variables to
known variables. We present a sample of variables flagged as interesting or
unusual.
